I have a weird question that is probably addressed early in physics classes that I never took.

What I would like to understand is, if space has no "center" per say, except maybe the starting point of the Big Bang. Then how do we measure speed at all? I mean, if for instance, Earth is the dead center of the universe. The Sun is then traveling around it at 1 cycle a year but the other planets aren't traveling around the Earth. So, what would you relate their speeds to? Would they be speeding up as the planets move away and slowing down as they get closer, because from our perspective we wouldn't be seeing them at the same speed. This, I understand, is the whole reason calculus exists. So, I know I am over simplifying the issue and probably misunderstanding something crucial.

For instance, if the universe (meaning whatever space/time we are sitting in) is traveling at 1 trillion mph in a single direction, then we go backwards into that direction at the same speed, wouldn't we be stopping? So, if we are going backwards into space at that stopping speed, would special relativity kick in and cause us to experience time dilation, or would there not be any effect at all, since we are technically losing speed.

or is space/time affixed in such a way that empty space is just a consistent thing that doesn't have the properties I'm giving it, but if that's the case, what about if it were in relation to the galactic spin. So, that instead of us moving with our arm of the Milky Way, we "stop" in relation to it? Which would require us moving at enormous speeds relative to it.

I hope I explained that well, anyways, thanks for your time whoever reads this.

Relativistic beaming for those interested involves a planet tugging on the star causing an increase in the density of photons towards the observer thus making the star brighter. Its limited to Jupiter-like planets at distance of 0.025 AU. So its not very practical but serves as a method for checking other techniques.

Henry, I was going to rip on you for not suggesting we just pack our bags and get out there, but than you snuck Isaac into your little ad at the end and you redeemed yourself.

Baby steps, I guess. Just tired of being trapped in this crib, so I guess it's time to tear off my diaper and throw shit at the window. Maybe that'll have some effect?

I suppose nothing will ever be enough though.

Thanks for mentioning Isaac, but as an outdoorsy type I'd expect a little more motivation from you telling us to get this whole biological cycles stuff condensed and perfected so we can just package ourselves in cans and forage for spare hydrogen along the way. Learn to live off the land, where in this case the land will be a grain of dust every million k and a stop at an asteroid and a few comets along the way.

We set our sails and we explore, for the thousands and thousands of years, generations of people who live their entire lives knowing nothing but life in the capsule, be it the size of a school bus or a stadium, it makes little difference accept to shorten or lengthen the time between which you consume the atoms of your relatives, corpse or coprolite, corn or a condensed carbohydrate coagulate served with stem cell farmed protein, it makes little difference so long as we get there.
Of course it makes a difference, but lets be realistic. We reuse the atoms of our ancestors already, why such a lengthy process? Can't we come to terms with this before the planet is covered in graveyards?

Anyway, onto space. We can't bring these stupid traditions with us. So either we throw them out or we throw out the idea of ever leaving this solar system. Because there is no way we're going to travel between the stars realistically and let the bodies that die along the way go to waste.

Yeah, I get that it'd be nice to know where we're going before we get out there.
Yes, it's nice to have eyes to look at my food before I eat it.

We're all going to be forgotten anyhow, why not be forgotten as the group of people who made it farther away from Earth than the voyager probe? Or the ones who made it as far out as the broadcasts the day their ancestor was born that decided to dedicate themselves to this mission? If that makes sense.

Be a hero.
